trans-unit.source: #ssl_cert_reqs: 0 # Should be 0 for ssl.CERT_NONE, 1 for ssl.CERT_OPTIONAL, 2 for ssl.CERT_REQUIRED
trans-unit.target: #ssl_cert_reqs: 0 # Should be 0 for ssl.CERT_NONE, 1 for ssl.CERT_OPTIONAL, 2 for ssl.CERT_REQUIRED

trans-unit.source: - If the agent has died and won't restart, remove any files found in ``/var/run/newrelic/``
trans-unit.target: - If the agent has died and won't restart, remove any files found in ``/var/run/newrelic/``

trans-unit.source: - If the agent starts but dies shortly after ensure that ``/var/log/newrelic`` and ``/var/run/newrelic`` are writable by the same user specified in the daemon section of the configuration file.
trans-unit.target: - If the agent starts but dies shortly after ensure that ``/var/log/newrelic`` and ``/var/run/newrelic`` are writable by the same user specified in the daemon section of the configuration file.

trans-unit.source: - If the application installs but doesn't seem to be submitting status, check the logfile which at ``/tmp/newrelic-plugin-agent.log`` if the default example logging configuration is used.
trans-unit.target: - If the application installs but doesn't seem to be submitting status, check the logfile which at ``/tmp/newrelic-plugin-agent.log`` if the default example logging configuration is used.

trans-unit.source: - If the installation does not install the ``newrelic-plugin-agent`` application in ``/usr/bin`` then it is likely that ``setuptools`` or ``distribute`` is not up to date. The following commands can be run to install ``distribute`` and ``pip`` for installing the application:
trans-unit.target: - If the installation does not install the ``newrelic-plugin-agent`` application in ``/usr/bin`` then it is likely that ``setuptools`` or ``distribute`` is not up to date. The following commands can be run to install ``distribute`` and ``pip`` for installing the application:

trans-unit.source: - If using the Apache HTTP plugin and your stats are blank, ensure the ExtendedStatus directive is on.
trans-unit.target: - If using the Apache HTTP plugin and your stats are blank, ensure the ExtendedStatus directive is on.

trans-unit.source: 2. Copy the configuration file example from ``/opt/newrelic-plugin-agent/newrelic-plugin-agent.cfg`` to ``/etc/newrelic/newrelic-plugin-agent.cfg`` and edit the configuration in that file.
trans-unit.target: 2. Copy the configuration file example from ``/opt/newrelic-plugin-agent/newrelic-plugin-agent.cfg`` to ``/etc/newrelic/newrelic-plugin-agent.cfg`` and edit the configuration in that file.

trans-unit.source: 3. Make a ``/var/log/newrelic`` directory and make sure it is writable by the user specified in the configuration file
trans-unit.target: 3. Make a ``/var/log/newrelic`` directory and make sure it is writable by the user specified in the configuration file

trans-unit.source: 4. Make a ``/var/run/newrelic`` directory and make sure it is writable by the user specified in the configuration file
trans-unit.target: 4. Make a ``/var/run/newrelic`` directory and make sure it is writable by the user specified in the configuration file

trans-unit.source: Copy the ``apc-nrp.php`` script to a directory that can be served by your web server or ``php-fpm`` application. Edit the ``newrelic-plugin-agent`` configuration to point to the appropriate URL.
trans-unit.target: Copy the ``apc-nrp.php`` script to a directory that can be served by your web server or ``php-fpm`` application. Edit the ``newrelic-plugin-agent`` configuration to point to the appropriate URL.

trans-unit.source: If you are monitoring Apache HTTPd via a HTTPS connection you can use the ``verify_ssl_cert`` configuration value in the httpd configuration section to disable SSL certificate verification.
trans-unit.target: If you are monitoring Apache HTTPd via a HTTPS connection you can use the ``verify_ssl_cert`` configuration value in the httpd configuration section to disable SSL certificate verification.

trans-unit.source: If you are monitoring Nginx via a HTTPS connection you can use the ``verify_ssl_cert`` configuration value in the httpd configuration section to disable SSL certificate verification.
trans-unit.target: If you are monitoring Nginx via a HTTPS connection you can use the ``verify_ssl_cert`` configuration value in the httpd configuration section to disable SSL certificate verification.

trans-unit.target: If you are monitoring RabbitMQ via a HTTPS connection you can use the ``verify_ssl_cert`` configuration value in the httpd configuration section to disable SSL certificate verification.

trans-unit.source: Python based agent for collecting metrics for NewRelic
trans-unit.target: Python based agent for collecting metrics for NewRelic

trans-unit.source: Sample configuration and init.d scripts are installed to ``/opt/newrelic-plugin-agent`` in addition to a PHP script required for APC monitoring.
trans-unit.target: Sample configuration and init.d scripts are installed to ``/opt/newrelic-plugin-agent`` in addition to a PHP script required for APC monitoring.

trans-unit.target: Several of the checks take O(N) time where N is the number of relations

trans-unit.source: The Redis plugin can communicate either over UNIX domain sockets using the path configuration variable or TCP/IP using the host and port variables. Do not include both.
trans-unit.target: The Redis plugin can communicate either over UNIX domain sockets using the path configuration variable or TCP/IP using the host and port variables. Do not include both.

trans-unit.source: The UWSGI plugin can communicate either over UNIX domain sockets using the path configuration variable or TCP/IP using the host and port variables. Do not include both.
trans-unit.target: The UWSGI plugin can communicate either over UNIX domain sockets using the path configuration variable or TCP/IP using the host and port variables. Do not include both.

trans-unit.source: The agent requires Python 2.6 or 2.7 and ``pip`` for installation. Individual plugin backends may require additional libraries and are detailed below.
trans-unit.target: The agent requires Python 2.6 or 2.7 and ``pip`` for installation. Individual plugin backends may require additional libraries and are detailed below.

trans-unit.source: The agent requires the extended information to parse metrics. If you are not seeing any metrics on your graphs for Apache verify that you have enabled ``ExtendedStatus``, the default is off so you must enable it. In your global Apache HTTP configuration you need to enable exetended status using:
trans-unit.target: The agent requires the extended information to parse metrics. If you are not seeing any metrics on your graphs for Apache verify that you have enabled ``ExtendedStatus``, the default is off so you must enable it. In your global Apache HTTP configuration you need to enable exetended status using:

trans-unit.source: The configuration file uses YAML as its format. Most tickets for non-working installs are due to configuration file formatting errors. Please make sure you are properly formatting your configuration file prior to submitting a ticket. YAML is a whitespace dependent markup format. More information on writing proper YAML can be found at http://yaml.org.
trans-unit.target: The configuration file uses YAML as its format. Most tickets for non-working installs are due to configuration file formatting errors. Please make sure you are properly formatting your configuration file prior to submitting a ticket. YAML is a whitespace dependent markup format. More information on writing proper YAML can be found at http://yaml.org.

trans-unit.source: The fields for plugin configurations can vary due to a plugin's configuration requirements. The name value in each stanza is only required when using multiple targets in a plugin. If it is only a single target, the name will be taken from the server's hostname.
trans-unit.target: The fields for plugin configurations can vary due to a plugin's configuration requirements. The name value in each stanza is only required when using multiple targets in a plugin. If it is only a single target, the name will be taken from the server's hostname.

trans-unit.source: The memcached plugin can communicate either over UNIX domain sockets using the path configuration variable or TCP/IP using the host and port variables. Do not include both.
trans-unit.target: The memcached plugin can communicate either over UNIX domain sockets using the path configuration variable or TCP/IP using the host and port variables. Do not include both.

trans-unit.source: The user specified must be a stats user.
trans-unit.target: The user specified must be a stats user.

trans-unit.source: The user specified must have access to all virtual hosts you wish to monitor and should have either the Administrator tag or the Monitoring tag.
trans-unit.target: The user specified must have access to all virtual hosts you wish to monitor and should have either the Administrator tag or the Monitoring tag.
